tweet: Today, I am heading to our Southern Border with my @HouseDemocrats colleagues to see first hand the conditions at the border, ports of entry, and DHS detentions camps. Follow me here and on FB ( http://www.facebook.com/RepBrownley/ ) to get updates on our trip. https://twitter.com/CNNPolitics/status/1156032932433154049 …

Our nation’s infrastructure is crumbling, and it impacts the lives of everyday Americans. It’s past time that we develop bipartisan, comprehensive infrastructure legislation, and I am committed to doing so. http://bit.ly/2K8gQtQ

No matter what is happening in our political landscape, we still must work together to get things done. That’s why I joined my @NewDemCoalition colleagues to send a letter to @POTUS urging him to recommit to working with Congress to solve our nation’s infrastructure crisis.

#OTD we celebrate the 54th anniversary of #Medicare and #Medicaid, which provide quality, affordable healthcare to more than 130 million Americans. In Congress, I will continue to protect and preserve these essential healthcare programs. pic.twitter.com/Bpziq8zQD7

Last week, I participated in the House Veterans’ Affairs Committee hearing on this issue and look forward to working with my colleagues to ensure VA is held accountable and that veterans are receiving the timely care they deserve. http://connectingvets.radio.com/articles/va-wait-times-scandal-report-congress-waitlist-progress-phoenix …

Five years after a whistleblower exposed the Phoenix VA wait time scandal, we still have a long way to go to ensure our veterans are getting the care they need, when they need it, without undue burden.#NationalWhistleblowerDay

Americans should not live in fear that their hard-earned retirement savings will disappear. Recently, I voted for the #ButchLewisAct to fix the nation’s worsening multi-employer pension crisis and protect 1.3 million American workers from losing their pension benefits. pic.twitter.com/Fu2NoZuPVt

This week, I was pleased to vote for the #StopBadRobocalls Act to stop the onslaught of disruptive robocalls once and for all. This comprehensive bill requires calls to be verified, allows the blocking of spam calls, and empowers @FCC to protect Americans from scammers. pic.twitter.com/d5yVzu5YCw

I was proud to vote for legislation that sets minimum, basic #HumanitarianStandards at DHS facilities. This bill would mandate the Trump Administration treat migrants with basic human decency, and it is critical that the Senate pass this bill now.

The conditions at many DHS facilities are abhorrent – from adults packed in standing-room only wire pens to children in cages who have been separated from their parents. We must address the inhumane conditions in which DHS is holding refugees and asylum seekers.

I held a #WomenVetsTaskForce roundtable to discuss bills our members have been working on to promote inclusivity and address the unique challenges and barriers women veterans face, and support the opportunities to achieve equity in access to resources, benefits, and healthcare. pic.twitter.com/l77uTXxHQI

Yesterday, the Select Committee on the @ClimateCrisis held a hearing on the risks posed to businesses by the climate crisis, but also the opportunities greening our economy can create. It’s time to #ActOnClimate now so that we can build a 21st century sustainable, green economy.

Protecting American democracy. Fighting for #PaycheckFairness. Enhancing #RetirementSecurity for middle-class families.  Demanding #ClimateActionNow. @HouseDemocrats have been hard at work #ForThePeople during our first #200DaysOfProgress. pic.twitter.com/GWrLQAJnS9

Read more about the bill, here ⬇ http://juliabrownley.house.gov/brownley-introduces-legislation-to-expand-women-veterans-access-to-comprehensive-contraception-care/ …

I introduced the Equal Access to Contraception for Veterans Act to address this critical disparity that prevents women vets from having equal access to health care, and I look forward to working with my colleagues to ensure we fix this glaring gap in care for our women vets.
As the Chairwoman of the Women Veterans Task Force, my goal is to identify disparities in health care for women veterans and introduce, advocate for, and pass legislation that fixes those inequities.

Women veterans now make up the fastest growing group of veterans enrolling in VA health care. Yet, many of their health needs go unaddressed. This includes accessing basic contraceptive services without a co-pay, which is available to all women using civilian health insurance.

Recently, @VetAffairsDems launched an investigation into VA’s San Juan medical center due to our concerns about VA’s disaster response capabilities. Today, we are heading to Puerto Rico to assess VA’s disaster response and emergency preparedness efforts to serve our veterans. https://twitter.com/VetAffairsDems/status/1151599818768338948 …

The current federal minimum wage has been stuck at $7.25/hour for 10 years, the longest period without an increase in U.S. history. Today, I was proud to vote to #RaiseTheWage to $15/hr for millions of working people because everyone deserves a livable wage. pic.twitter.com/WrfI2GYTgB

Former #SCOTUS Justice John Paul Stevens was a great man who had deep respect for the court and the rule of law. He was a principled thought leader our nation needs more of. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/16/us/john-paul-stevens-dead.html …

Americans have a fundamental right to comprehensive health care and accurate and life-saving health information free from government interference, and I will continue to fight against this Administration’s misguided and dangerous policy. #ProtectX

Sadly, the courts are upholding the Trump Administration’s new gag rule on Title X providers, which restricts access to healthcare for those in need, undermines the rights of women, and violates the important bond of trust between patients and providers.
#TitleX has provided comprehensive reproductive health care including affordable birth control to millions of Americans for over 40 years. https://twitter.com/NARAL/status/1151135442579836930 …

The #WomenVetsTaskForce, now 72 participating members strong, will continue to increase visibility of the two million women who have served in the U.S. military and promote inclusivity and equitable access to comprehensive healthcare, benefits, education and economic opportunity.

Women veterans are also over-represented in higher education compared to male veterans, and earn degrees at higher levels than non-veteran women. Women veterans are twice as likely to enter #STEM occupations than non-veteran women.
Women veterans are the fastest growing homeless population in the U.S., and continue to face a pay gap when compared to their male counterparts.

We learned from @FinalSaluteInc, @IVMFSyracuseU, @Service2School @studentvets and @ffWomenWarriors about economic challenges and opportunities facing #womenvets, including higher education, homelessness, career advancement, and entrepreneurship.

Last week, I joined @RepMikeLevin in the @VetAffairsDems Subcommittee on Economic Opportunity for a hearing on “Economic Well-Being of Women Veterans” in collaboration with the #WomenVetsTaskForce, which I’m proud to chair.
I applaud the work The Nature Conservancy and its partners are doing to protect this mosaic of habitats.

While there are many threats to the river, The Nature Conservancy is using its scientific expertise and its experience in land-use planning to protect and restore the Santa Clara River and its tributaries, restore the wetlands at Ormond Beach, and secure wildlife corridors.
On a picturesque day in Santa Paula, I recently had the opportunity to tour the Santa Clara River with @nature_org. pic.twitter.com/Ww3XnGKdeU

The more than 22,000 small businesses in Ventura County are the backbone of our economy and our communities. Anyone who wants to open a business and become a job creator should have access to the resources they need to succeed.

These Americans deserve real protections under the law, because they are part of our communities & valuable contributors to our nation. The House passed #H6, the #DreamandPromiseAct & it is time for the Senate to act swiftly & end this cruel uncertainty for our nation’s Dreamers.

While I hope that they affirm previous rulings that blocked the termination of DACA, Congress can still pass legislation that will provide permanent protections for Dreamers, who live in fear of being callously ripped away from their families & this country, which is their home.

Recently, #SCOTUS announced that it would hear arguments on whether Trump’s cruel decision to end DACA was legal. http://www.cbsnews.com/news/supreme-court-to-hear-arguments-in-legal-battle-over-daca-in-november/ …

Seven years ago, DACA was established and allowed for Dreamers to go to college and seek work without the threat of deportation. These young people have become an integral part of our communities -- they are our teachers, first responders, business owners, and neighbors.
I'm proud to support them on and off the field! #OneNationOneTeam

In Congress, I promise to stand up for the rights of all Americans and work until everyone has equal protection under the law.

.@HouseDemocrats are working tirelessly to protect and expand the cause of civil rights by passing monumental legislation like H.R. 4, the Voting Rights Advancement Act, which ensures that every American’s voice is heard through their vote.

As we reflect on this momentous achievement, we must recognize that while we have come a long way since 1964, the fight to end discrimination is far from over. Today, countless Americans face discrimination, not only at work or in school, but also at the ballot box.
55 years ago this week, President Johnson signed the landmark Civil Rights Act, banning discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, and national origin. pic.twitter.com/ydNONbN2OP
